detaileddescription.para: Init the DM camera layer. It should be called before any dmcam API is invoked.

parameterdescription.para: [in] specified log file name of dmcam layer. if NULL, the default log (dmcam_YYYYMMDD.log) is used.

detaileddescription.para: Uninit the DM camera layer.
Set the logging configuration for dmcam layer.

parameterdescription.para: [in] specified dmcam_log_level_e, the console log whose log level bellow this value will be suppressed.
[in] specified dmcam_log_level_e, the file log whose log level bellow this value will be suppressed.
[in] specified dmcam_log_level_e, the usb log whose log level bellow this value will be suppressed.

detaileddescription.para: Setting where to save calibration data

simplesect.para: __API void

detaileddescription.para: Getting calibration data path

simplesect.para: _API char*

detaileddescription.para: covert specified error code into error string

simplesect.para: const char*

detaileddescription.para: list the dmcam device and fill into dmcam_dev_t array.

parameterdescription.para: [out] device list array to be filled.

simplesect.para: int [out] number of dmcam device found

detaileddescription.para: open specified dmcam device. if the device is not specified, it'll try to open the first dmcam device

parameterdescription.para: [in] specified dmcam device which is usally get from dmcam_dev_list. if Null, the first dmcam device will be opened.

simplesect.para: dmcam_dev_t* NULL = open device failed.

detaileddescription.para: open specified dmcam device with specified fd. this is useful for android usb device.

simplesect.para: dmcam_dev_t* return opened device. NULL = open device failed.

detaileddescription.para: open specified dmcam device with specified uri.

parameterdescription.para: [in] specified URI. Following URI are supported: USB device URI: usb://bus:port or usb://bus:port:dev_addr Ethernet device URI: eth://hwid:token or eth://hwid:token FILE device URI: file://filename or filename

simplesect.para: dmcam_dev_t* NULL = open device failed.

detaileddescription.para: Close specified dmcam device.
get URI of specified device.

simplesect.para: const char* [out] uri string. If null, get uri failed.

detaileddescription.para: Reset specified target on the dev

simplesect.para: bool [out] true = reset ok.

memberdef.argsstring: (dmcam_dev_t *dev, dmcam_dev_reg_e target, uint32_t reg_base, const uint32_t *reg_vals, uint16_t reg_vals_len)
memberdef.name: dmcam_reg_batch_write

detaileddescription.para: Batch write registers of specified target on the device.

parameterdescription.para: [in] register values to be written. All register value is denoted as UINT32

simplesect.para: bool [out] true = write ok.

memberdef.argsstring: (dmcam_dev_t *dev, dmcam_dev_reg_e target, uint32_t reg_base, uint32_t *reg_vals, uint16_t reg_vals_len)
memberdef.name: dmcam_reg_batch_read

detaileddescription.para: Batch read registers of specified target on the device.

parameterdescription.para: [out] register values to be filled. All register value is denoted as UINT32

simplesect.para: bool [out] true = read ok.

detaileddescription.para: Batch write generic parameters to specified device.

parameterdescription.para:
[in] dmcam_param_item_t is used to denotes generic parameter:
param_id[in]: defined in dmcam_dev_param_e to identify the parameters.
param_vals[in]: denotes the generic value (max = 16bytes)
param_vals_len[in]: denotes the length of value.

simplesect.para: bool [out] true = operation is ok.

detaileddescription.para: Batch read generic parameters from specified device.

parameterdescription.para:
[in/out] dmcam_param_item_t is used to denotes generic parameter:
param_id[in]: defined in dmcam_dev_param_e to identify the parameters.
param_vals[out]: denotes the generic value (max = 16bytes) filled by this function
param_vals_len[out]: denotes the length of value filled by this function.

simplesect.para: bool [out] true = operation is ok.

detaileddescription.para: Set specified capture configuration for specified device. This api is available from v1.58 to replace dmcam_cap_set_frame_buffer

simplesect.para: bool [out] true = set OK.

detaileddescription.para: Get capture configuration of specified device
set frame buffer during capturing.

parameterdescription.para: [in] framebuffer assigned by user. if null, the frame_buf will be alloced internally
[in] frame buffer size, which will be rouned to frame size boundary.

simplesect.para: bool [out] return true = set ok.

detaileddescription.para: register frame ready callback function

parameterdescription.para: [in] callback function in following format: void (dmcam_cap_frdy_f)(dmcam_dev_t, dmcam_frame_t)

detaileddescription.para: register error callback function. It's invoked when some error occurs during the capturing process.

parameterdescription.para: [in] callback function in following format: void (dmcam_cap_err_f)(dmcam_dev_t, int errno);

detaileddescription.para: Take a snapshot and fill frame data into specified frame. If the device is capturing, the snapshot will return the latest image{} or it'll auto start/snapshot/stop

parameterdescription.para: [in] frame buffersize should be large enough to containing one frame.
[out] frame_t filled during snapshot. it can be null

simplesect.para: bool return true = ok

detaileddescription.para: Check whether the device is in capturing state.

simplesect.para: bool [out] true = device in capturing state

detaileddescription.para: start device capturing.

simplesect.para: bool return true = ok

detaileddescription.para: stop device capturing.

simplesect.para: bool return true = ok

memberdef.argsstring: (dmcam_dev_t *dev, uint32_t frame_num, uint8_t *frame_data, uint32_t frame_dlen, dmcam_frame_t *first_frame_info)
memberdef.name: dmcam_cap_get_frames

detaileddescription.para:
Get specified number of frames into specified user buffer. This function may be blocking wait on the frame stream. if enough frames data are collected or any error happends, it'll returns.
dev
[in] dmcam device handler
frame_num
[in] number of frames to be captured.
frame_data
[out] frame data filled curing capturing.
frame_dlen
[in] frame_data buffer size in bytes.
first_frame_info
[out] first frame attributes. It can be NULL
int [out] return the number for ready frames collected. On error the errono is returned. (errno < 0)
get one frame into specified buffer. this function is non-blocking, if no frame is ready, it returns 0

parameterdescription.para: [out] frame data to be filled, it can be NULL
[out] frame attributes. It can be NULL

simplesect.para: int return 0 if not frame is ready, else return 1

[in] raw frame data length in byte

simplesect.para: int [out] return the number for distance points in dst

parameterdescription.para: [out] distance buffer. The unit of distance is in millimeter (uint16)
[in] distance buffer length in number of uint16
[in] raw frame data length in byte

simplesect.para: int [out] return the number for distance points in dst

memberdef.argsstring: (dmcam_dev_t *dev, float *dst, int dst_len, uint8_t *src, int src_len, const dmcam_frame_info_t *finfo)

[in] distance buffer length in number of float
[in] raw frame data length in byte

simplesect.para: int [out] return the number for gray points in dst

memberdef.argsstring: (dmcam_dev_t *dev, uint16_t *dst, int dst_len, uint8_t *src, int src_len, const dmcam_frame_info_t *finfo)
memberdef.name: dmcam_frame_get_gray_u16

detaileddescription.para: get gray data in uint16_t from raw frame data.

parameterdescription.para: [out] gray buffer. The gray value denotes the amplitude. (uint16_t in [0, 2048))
[in] distance buffer length in number of uint16_t
[in] raw frame data length in byte

simplesect.para: int [out] return the number for gray points in dst

memberdef.argsstring: (dmcam_dev_t *dev, float *pcl, int pcl_len, const float *dist, int dist_len, int img_w, int img_h, const dmcam_camera_para_t *p_cam_param)
memberdef.name: dmcam_frame_get_pcl

detaileddescription.para: get point cloud data from distance data. The distance data is usually calcuated using dmcam_frame_get_dist_f32.

parameterdescription.para: [out] point clound buffer. each 3 element consists a (x,y,z) point, output is in (w,h,3) demension. point in value (0,0,0) is invalid
[in] distance image data buffer. The unit of distance is meter (float)
[in] user specified camera lens parameter. if null, the internal camera parameter is used.

simplesect.para: int [out] return number of points in point cloud buffer. Note: n points means 3*n floats. N should be img_w * img_h

memberdef.argsstring: (dmcam_dev_t *dev, float *pcl, int pcl_len, const float *dist, int dist_len, int img_w, int img_h, bool pseudo_color, const dmcam_camera_para_t *p_cam_param)
memberdef.name: dmcam_frame_get_pcl_xyzd

detaileddescription.para: get point cloud data from distance data. The distance data is usually calcuated using dmcam_frame_get_distance.

parameterdescription.para: [out] point clound buffer. each 4 element consists a (x,y,z,d) point. (x,y,z) is coordinate, d is distance or pseudo-color. output is in (w,h,4) demension. point in value (0,0,0) is invalid
[in] distance image data buffer. The unit of distance is meter (float)
[in] if true, d is pseudo uint32 rgb color value; if false, d is the distance in meter
[in] user specified camera lens parameter. if null, the internal camera parameter is used.

simplesect.para: int [out] return number of points in point cloud buffer. Note: n points means 4*n floats. N should be img_w * img_h

detaileddescription.para: Enable filter controller setting for raw data processing

parameterdescription.para: [in]:defined in dmcam_filter_id_e to identify the filter
[in] reserved for future use. User should set to 0

simplesect.para: int 0 = OK, otherwise failed.

detaileddescription.para: Disable filter controller setting for raw data processing

parameterdescription.para: [in] defined in dmcam_filter_id_e to identify the filter

simplesect.para: int 0 = OK, otherwise failed.

detaileddescription.para: open specified file and get file descriptor for dmcam_frame_save_xxx apis.

simplesect.para: int [out] file descriptor. < 0 = failed

detaileddescription.para: close specified file descriptor

memberdef.argsstring: (int fd, dmcam_frame_save_fmt_t save_fmt, const uint16_t *raw, int raw_len, int img_w, int img_h, int dcs_cnt, const char *raw_tag)
memberdef.name: dmcam_frame_save_raw

detaileddescription.para: save specified raw data (in uin16_t) with specified pixcel width and height to file with specified saving format.

parameterdescription.para: [in] file saving format defined in dmcam_frame_save_fmt_t. only followin format is supported: DMCAM_FRAME_SAVE_UINT32 DMCAM_FRAME_SAVE_UINT16
[in] number of raw data (in count of uint16_t)
[in] any string. if want to used by replay, specify (dmcam_t*)dev->product string here.

simplesect.para: bool [out] true = save raw frame ok, false = fail

memberdef.argsstring: (int fd, dmcam_frame_save_fmt_t save_fmt, const float *dist, int dist_len, int img_w, int img_h)
memberdef.name: dmcam_frame_save_distance

detaileddescription.para: save specified distance data (in float32, unit: meter) with specified pixcel width and height to file with specified saving format.

parameterdescription.para: [in] file saving format defined in @ dmcam_frame_save_fmt_t. only followin format is supported: DMCAM_FRAME_SAVE_FLOAT32 DMCAM_FRAME_SAVE_UINT32 DMCAM_FRAME_SAVE_UINT16
[in] number of distance data (in count of float)

simplesect.para: bool [out] true = save distance frame ok, false = fail

memberdef.argsstring: (int fd, dmcam_frame_save_fmt_t save_fmt, const float *src, int src_len, int img_w, int img_h)
memberdef.name: dmcam_frame_save_gray

detaileddescription.para: save specified gray data (in float32) with specified pixcel width and height to file with specified saving format.

parameterdescription.para: [in] file saving format defined in dmcam_frame_save_fmt_t. only followin format is supported: DMCAM_FRAME_SAVE_UINT16 DMCAM_FRAME_SAVE_UINT8
[in] number of distance data (in count of float)

simplesect.para: bool [out] true = save distance frame ok, false = fail
